name: roastbeet
text: How would Ray react if it was him instead of Cornelius?

name: juancarlos
text: "Classic Lyle".

name: em2
text: Yeah, his character is pretty much canon by this point.

name: rowboat
text: He'd act dignified about it, pretend to blow it off, then never use the thing again.

name: luckypyjamas
text: He'd just sit there, not being a woman, and Lyle would be wrong

name: straw
text: Wow, all of those are good answers.

name: saint
text: Rap battle?

name: hatstand_mcq
text: Whatever dude. You be all stanky and gross if you want to. I'm a sit here and be cool while you go and wash your socks in some old soup and get thrush so as a dog vomits when you go near. Perhaps I'll go to a club later. I'll get rutty with some of the ladies you compare me to, on account of my not smelling like half a racoon in a sack.

name: zzzleepy
text: in the top five for sure.  lyle has a really good point, and he makes his argument well.

name: juancarlos
text: A comment left by juancarlos was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nighttoad, twentyfivepast, invidious, kylank, DeimosRising, equinn2006, rhymesforkids, nutmeg, bixschmix, joamiq)

name: dboothe
text: A comment left by dboothe was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by FuckYou, Overmedicated, kylank, JuanCarlos, Darthemed)

name: tekende
text: This is a hilarious misunderstanding.

name: woodenteeth
text: I look forward to all of you imagining a terrified Dolly inside someone's testicle. That is not somewhere you want to wake up.

name: tekende
text: Seriously, juancarlos's misreading is truly histerical. Not only does he mistake the word, he still makes it work in an amusing manner. He jams that square peg into a round hole without even noticing the effort involved.

name: belgand
text: A square peg will easily fit into a round hole. It all just depends on the diameter.

name: tekende
text: Was your pedantry really necessary here, belgand? Was it?

name: belgand
text:
1) Yes. Pedantry is always necessary and its own reward.
2) I never understood that expression. Honestly. Square pegs easily go into round holes. It's not really a function of shape. I find it to be a deeply confusing expression.

name: tekende
text:
You don't understand the expression? You know those children's toys that tend to look like a little plastic workbench? And they have different shaped holes which are all about the same size. They have circles, squares, maybe a triangle or something. And there are corresponding plastic pieces that fit these holes, and children take the pieces and fit them in the holes, maybe with the assistance of a little plastic hammer. It builds shape recognition and hand-eye coordination. The pieces and the holes are designed so that each piece only fits its corresponding hole. Thus, you cannot put the square peg in the round hole, because the hole's diameter isn't big enough.

Anyway, I think you do understand the expression and are just being smug and difficult.

name: belgand
text: No, I understand the expression, but it's never really made a lot of sense to me. A square peg is the next best thing to fit into a round hole and fill it more or less completely. It only requires a slightly larger diameter as well. It just always seemed like a weird expression to me. Trying to fit the square peg into the triangular hole always seemed like it would be a hell of a lot more difficult and fruitless. Not trying to be difficult or anything, it's just how I feel. Perhaps I was speaking poorly earlier.

name: layzerblade
text: Not to mention that fitting a square peg into a slightly smaller round hole is a proven method of joining two pieces of wood without nails.

name: deimosrising
text: A comment left by deimosrising was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by DR_MANFLESH_DESIRES_ANAL_PLAY_IMMEDIATELY, Vice, a_dude, hikikomori, monkeysauce, ralgnar, dr_sexlove)

name: straw
text: Shut up man llamas are great.

name: jonmw
text:
Correction: llamas that look like Prince are great.
Seriously, have you ever seen the full-sized and complete version of your avatar? The similarity to Prince is pretty staggering.

name: i_love_kate
text: I read this as "Vote five or I will come on you in the night." Hilarious!

name: mashisoyo
text: Man why did 7 people lame this I don't even

name: zem
text: I love this strip

name: kahrytes
text: Mr. Bear looks so indignant in the last panel.

name: mortshire
text: cold turning the other cheek.

name: arcibi
text: I'm not afraid to admit that I got a hearty chuckle out of this strip

name: nexus
text:
Hehe, this one's awesome.

Nothing like driving an insult to the ground.

name: arcellus
text: oh god it's so good

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: The alt-text: "Lyle travels through the living room, agitated by drink".  If Lyle had a Homeric epithet, this would be it.

name: radishes
text: It truly is a wonderful alt text.

name: idsyen
text: The alt-text is really where it's at in this strip.

name: kotekan
text: Chubbied for "Homeric epithet."

name: craigola
text: Man, Cornelius Bear is such a badass, he doesn't even grab Lyle's finger and snap it off!

name: syrinx
text:
I wasn't feeling this strip, but that last panel ended me.

I just looked at it again... god damn.

name: 1000hz
text: Raise it proud and raise it high, Lyle.

name: zedpower
text: What's worse? Being a dick to a stranger, or being a dick to a guy you know?

name: evolume
text: The Lyle flippin' the bird pin is my favorite one.

name: oishii
text: Oh, Lyle. So crass yet so adorable.

name: tttt
text: registered just to say that this is a 5

name: godfatherofsouls
text: good job. five the HELL outta this biz.

name: quarantine
text: The bird really makes this strip.

name: wharfrat
text: i can just imagine the awkward pause before the finger goes up

name: opalleye
text:
Surgeon General's Warning:
Fan use causes Ovarian Freezing and may complicate pregnancy.

name: anitrophaeron
text: Hmm....I'm feeling a bit odd at the moment because I just squawked.  Like full on parrot-style.  I read the alt-text and it just came bursting out.  I...I need to be alone...

name: tekende
text: Fie on your rasied middle finger, Lyle. Fie!

name: gopacapulco
text: bird at the end is perfect

name: tslothrop
text: Always punctuate with The Finger.

name: brynito
text: I don't know why, maybe it's the last panel, but I love this strip best of all.

name: froggle
text: man, this strip just totally sold me on Achewood.

name: unsentletter
text:
This strip is unrelenting!

Lyle is being Lyle!

name: snowman
text:
5 5 5

...oh god...it's just so uncalled for...

name: foetus_punch
text: Whenever I completely drive an insult into the ground, I always make sure to punctuate it by flipping the bird and saying go straight to hell.

name: fosters
text: Any strip that ends with Lyle flipping someone off is an automatic 5 from me. Usually because it's so completely unnecessary but Lyle just can't resist adding JUST A LITTLE MORE insult.

name: pzukowski
text: Drunks are so sloppy funny

name: woodenteeth
text: Lyle's "Bird" in this strip is entirely the anti-climactic gold that really makes me enjoy Onstad's humour. Sometimes by not trying to hard it's funnier on so many other levels.

name: seph
text:
Little does Lyle know his dolly-sittin' butt will someday trounce him in an all out test of supernal manliness.

It's interesting to think whether Onstad always had these future directions for the characters planned or if he just kind of winged it.

name: prine
text: The fact that he takes a step back in order to flip Cornelius off makes it even better.

name: tekende
text: You can almost see beams of light flashing off that raised finger. A chorus of demons sings a slightly atonal C# from somewhere unseen.

name: zapatos
text: Then Lyle decided, it would be a good idea to flip people off.  All the time.

name: origotoshi
text: This is also my favorite comic so far. I just love how Lyle looks so pissed off while he's the one insulting Mr. Bear. That finger at the end is the perfect ending too. Just a totally unnecessary punctuation mark he throws in.
